subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Lexical sets and QS letters
msgSnippet: ... Good! I mean, now I think we have a very concrete example to go by. For the word buy you say use Ice, and I think Anthony says use Ice if you are an
messageBody:
John Cowan wrote:
>
>
> Paul Tremblay scripsit:
>
> > In contrast, John, are you saying that since "buy" belongs to the PRICE
> > lexical set, that any user always uses "Bob" "Ice" for the spelling?
>
> Exactly so.
>

Good! I mean, now I think we have a very concrete example to go by. For
the word "buy" you say use "Ice," and I think Anthony says use "Ice" if
you are an American, but use "Oy" if you are Australian. That is a big
difference that illuminates the different approach.

Paul
